question: coerce

ans.value: to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
the feeling of no longer having any hope
a tall, thick stone or dirt wall that is built around a castle, town, etc., to protect it from attacks
to support, strengthen, or defend (something)

examples: He was coerced into signing the confession.
Soldiers coerced the residents into giving them food.
The singer was coerced into a contract with the record company.

question: Caustic

ans.value: very harsh and critical
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
a tall, thick stone or dirt wall that is built around a castle, town, etc., to protect it from attacks
the feeling of no longer having any hope

a tall, thick stone or dirt wall that is built around a castle, town, etc., to protect it from attacks

very harsh and critical

ans.value: very harsh and critical
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
to support, strengthen, or defend (something)

examples: The treaty will buttress the cause of peace.
